In 2016, I began collaborating with the Italian motion design studio Alkanoids, creators of ARIA—an AR platform designed for augmented reality applications in art, communication, advertising, gaming, and social interactions.
This collaboration has allowed me to explore the intersection of creativity and technology.
Augmented reality, as facilitated by ARIA, has proven to be a potent tool for amplifying brand messages and showcasing products in immersive ways.

By seamlessly blending virtual elements with the real world, augmented reality enhances storytelling in advertising, creates interactive gaming experiences, and transforms art into a captivating, multi-dimensional spectacle.
It's a journey of pushing creative boundaries and leveraging technology to redefine how we connect with audiences in the digital age.

In 2014, I embarked on a journey into presentation design. This passion led to a collaboration with Touchline, a communication agency based in London, Geneva and Dubai.
Together, we aimed to revolutionize presentations, making them dynamic and engaging.

My goal is to elevate the traditional panorama of presentations with creativity and interactivity - delving into the realms of visual storytelling and data visualization, pushing the boundaries of conventional keynotes to create immersive narratives.
My work has resonated with the top MENA clients, including EXPO 2020 Dubai, Dubai Tourism and the Dubai Motor Show.

Drawing on my experience with complex clients such as Touchline Dubai, Expo 2020, and Dubai Tourism, I've honed my expertise in crafting impactful data visualizations, and I've developed a keen understanding of the intricacies of presenting complex information with clarity and precision.
My work goes beyond aesthetics, incorporating interactivity and editability to meet the diverse needs of clients.
By combining technology integration and real-time updates, I've successfully delivered visualizations that not only engage but also facilitate efficient data exploration.
Upholding ethical standards and ensuring accessibility, my approach to data visualization reflects a commitment to delivering insightful narratives that resonate with diverse audiences.

Back in 2014, I embarked on a fascinating immersive video journey, experimenting with 12K cameras and combining six lenses informations to create a 360 stereoscopic experience.
Along the way, armed with an Insta 360 Pro and Mistika VR, I enjoyed working on diverse projects in Dubai, ranging from government initiatives to educational endeavors and Expo 2020 engagements.
The post-production phase was a technical whirlwind, seamlessly integrating CGI into the footage in an insanely high pixel count (for the time).
Venturing into immersive events, I set up VR caves and explored aerial and underwater VR, and affiliating with IVRPA, I became part of the immersive video community.
Reflecting on it now, in 2014 the timing was not right for mass adoption.
Hopefully in 2024, with the advent of Apple Vision Pro and the latest technological developments, the landscape is ripe for the creation of sophisticated immersive video content.

Immersive Video

Back in 2012 I started experimenting with Projection Mapping, after a workshop in Milano with Claudio Sinatti on interaction design with Quartz Composer, and another workshop with AreaOdeon that culminated in an event at Villa Reale in Monza.
Projection mapping is a transformative visual technique that involves the projection of digital content onto various surfaces, creating captivating and immersive experiences.
In architectural projection mapping, buildings become dynamic canvases as intricate designs and animations are mapped onto their surfaces, breathing life into static structures.
This art form has been widely embraced in events, enabling the manipulation of spatial perceptions and enhancing storytelling.
Additionally, on product projection mapping takes ordinary objects and turns them into dynamic showcases, allowing for unique presentations and interactive displays.
This versatile medium has revolutionized the way we engage with our surroundings, pushing the boundaries of creativity and providing a powerful means of communication in diverse contexts.

In image editing and visual content creation, tasks like objects removal, screen replacement, beauty retouch, paint fixing, and digital makeup play pivotal roles.

Objects are removed for cleaner compositions, screens are seamlessly replaced with new content, beauty is enhanced through retouching, imperfections are corrected in digital art, and digital makeup transforms or improves a subject's appearance.
These techniques collectively refine and elevate visual content, ensuring compelling and polished results across diverse creative mediums.

In video post-production, the process of removing blemishes, pimples, and imperfections from the skin of a talent is commonly referred to as "beauty retouching" or "skin retouching."
This technique involves digitally enhancing the appearance of the talent's skin to create a smoother and more flawless complexion.
Beauty retouching is often used to achieve a polished and refined look in the final video, ensuring that the talent's visual presentation aligns with the desired aesthetic standards.

As a content producer and finishing artist for fashion, I bring my expertise beyond conventional shooting and color grading, delving into the captivating world of fashion videography.
Utilizing advanced touch-up techniques, I meticulously enhance the visual allure of garments, prioritizing fidelity to their true colors.
With a keen eye for detail, I strive to strike a balance that not only showcases apparel in its truest form but also accentuates its inherent beauty.
Recognizing the importance of authenticity in portraying fashion, I aim to craft a visual symphony that not only showcases clothing but also celebrates the artistry behind each piece.
The integration of sound effects and foley contributes to a multisensory experience, making each fashion video a feast for the eyes and ears.

As a foodie, colorist and finishing artist, when immersed in the captivating realm of food post-production, I strive to strike a delicate balance that renders dishes irresistibly appetizing on screen while authentically mirroring their real-life vibrancy, crafting a visual symphony that invites the viewer into a realm of gastronomic delight.
The artful use of sound effects and Foley further heightens the sensory experience, ensuring that each video becomes a feast for the eyes and ears.
This all converge to create visually stimulating food content, authentically capturing the essence of culinary creations and inviting audiences to savor the richness of every dish.

In my role as an online editor, I specialize in crafting compelling visual narratives for TV series, cinema, and home video.

In the home video domain, I adapt content for diverse platforms, ensuring top-notch visual and audio quality. While I used to author DVD and Blu-Ray masters, the landscape has shifted, and now, everything resides in the cloud.

For TV series, I meticulously edit episodes, ensuring seamless structure, titles, localised audio tracks, and compliance with broadcast standards, by utilising the right QC tools (and know what to look for!)
In cinema, I collaborate with producers to refine titles, integrate visual effects and produce deliverables, as DCP.
My reel showcases my ability to combine creativity with technical expertise to deliver polished and engaging final products.

Throughout the years, I've placed a few tracks on some of my favourite TV series and feature movies, such as Better Call Saul, Enough Said, and House of Lies.
It's a thrilling journey to see my music become an integral part of these visual narratives, creating emotional resonance and complementing the overall cinematic experience for audiences worldwide.

I specialize in composing versatile and engaging royalty-free music tailored for a diverse range of platforms.

Whether it's the digital realm of the web, the dynamic visuals of video content, the auditory landscape of radio, or the impactful world of advertising, my musical compositions are crafted to enhance and elevate the overall experience.
With a keen understanding of the unique demands of each medium, I strive to create soundscapes that not only complement the visuals but also resonate with the intended audience.
From ambient tunes to upbeat anthems, my goal is to provide a seamless and evocative musical backdrop that adds depth and emotion to various forms of media.

Hailing from the vibrant city of Milan, Italy, Musetta emerged from the musical landscape in 2008, making a significant impact on the downtempo scene with their debut album, "Mice to meet you!" In this innovative collaboration, Marinella Mastrosimone's haunting lyrics seamlessly intertwine with Matteo Curcio's evocative atmospheres, giving rise to a formidable collection of tracks that not only showcase technical mastery but also draw inspiration from the avant-garde aesthetics of early 20th-century arts, the captivating allure of film-noir, and the imaginative realms of science fiction. The result is a unique musical journey that encapsulates a retro feel infused with a futuristic edge, creating a sound that is both timeless and forward-thinking. Musetta's ability to blend genres and transcend musical boundaries has solidified their presence in the electronic music landscape, captivating audiences with their distinctive and cinematic sonic offerings.
